column4: When I go to install ubuntu and it comes to the disk partitioning step in the process I can't get past it.  I'm missing one of the partition options. (the one I need)
which option you need?
which option are you missing

you dont have that option because you probably dont have any free space, what you need to do is ,,,, press Alt-F2, and type "gksudo gparted" and shrink your current windows partition to whatever size you want, and leave some "free space", then restart the installer and you will have that option
:free space" in the partitioiner means, space which is not formated (or outside any existing partitions)
how large are them?
do they have anything inside?
are they formated to any type of filesystem?
umm, then the option of "use largest continous...." should be enabled, would you mind sending me a screenshot of "gparted" showing your partitions?
the program gparted, you can launch it by typing Alt+F2, then type "gksudo gparted"
ohh, nvm then
problem is that windows vista wont see any "ext3" partition or linux type partition,  have you tryied installing linux before?
well,  may i see the info on your vista partitioner?
k, gime a sev

you should be good by removing all the "green stuff" which is a secondary partition (i duno why they are there, they arent been used anyways), once you delete that, you will end up with "unallocated space" which whill be usable by the ubuntu installer
did you partitioned  your hdd before?, or those partitions came like that by default?
you cant?, any error message?
which error
id try to delete them with gparted (in the live cd), gparted is ubuntu partitioner, once you are in the live cd, type alt-F2 and type "gksudo gparted" to launch it
if you still have problems, id be glad to keep helping, you can contact me by sending me a private message through ubuntu forums to "sam_delta"
id try ubuntu partitioner (to delete those partitions)
no proble, have a nice day
